title: User level App-to-App media (Audio/MIDI/Video)
body: Windows should allow users to freely redirect media (Audio, MIDI even Video someday, I guess) from/to the Hardware(audio interface, webcam, etc) and/or Applications (even considering "The Desktop" as a video+audio media generator).

comments.body: Wanted to note that the new MIDI APIs are broken - they return the wrong device names, and according to some GitHub posts, crash on sysex messages.

Yes. It could only be a good thing if the Windows Store could offer a platform for developing exclusive, standalone and dedicated multi-touch tools and controllers. Right now, I have to rely on running at least two third-party external softwares to achieve anything close.

This would be a huge help to the music production community - both the ability to route audio through a DAW and the ability to create software MIDI ports, enabling things like touch screen or webcam/CV MIDI controllers without having to set up a 3rd party driver.
Inter-app audio API for UWP, like iOS, AudioBus, JACK
That is indeed a feature that I miss very often...

I would like to add that it would be nice to be able to route one node to multiple others. Also merging several nodes/devices into one would be great e.g. how one can create virtual aggregate soundcards from real ones on a Macintosh.
